vc.prottype: FWLIBAPI short WINAPI cnc_rdpmacro(unsigned short FlibHndl, long number, ODBPM *pmacro);

cmn.p: Reads the P code macro variable (variable for the macro-executor) specified by "number". The data is stored in "ODBPM" with signed binary format.

It is possible to exchange the type of P code macro variable by cnc_setpmactype function. In case of the integer type variable, this indication is invalid and always regarded as the decimal form floating-point type.

tr.td:
value of variable (=M)
4-byte binary data with sign
(available range:999999999,..,-999999999, integer type:-32768,..,32767)

number of places of decimals (=E)
2-byte binary data with sign
(available range:-128,..,127, integer type : 0)

ul.p: mcr_val always returns by nine digits and adjusts the amount with the value of dec_val.
ul.blockquote:
Example: When the variable value is 12.345, mcr_val and dec_val are read as follows.
mcr_val = 123450000
dec_val = 7

tr.td:
numerical part of variable (=M)
4-byte binary data with sign
(available range:No limitation)

exponent part of variable (=E)
2-byte binary data with sign
(available range:-128,..,127)

cmn.p: The value of an undefined variable is called "vacant", and it is expressed as follows both at decimal form floating-point type and at binary form floating-point type.
See the "PROGRAMING MANUAL" of the macro-executor for details of the P code macro variable.

content.p: Specify the library handle. See "Library handle" for details.
Specify the P code macro variable number. See the description of cnc_rdpmacroinfo function about the available range.
Pointer to the ODBPM structure including the P code macro variable. The ODBPM structure is as follows.

item.name: EW_NUMBER
item.content:
Data number error
P code macro variable number(number) is wrong.

item.name: EW_NOOPT
item.content:
No option
This function needs the macro-executor option.

item.name: EW_PASSWD
item.content:
Specified P code macro variable cannot be read because the data is protected.
( Series 16i/18i/21i, 0i-A/B/C )

option.hssb: The extended driver/library function is necessary.

ethr.p: The Ethernet function and the extended driver/library function are necessary.
However, in case of Series 16i/18i/21i-B, 0i-B/C/D/F, Series 30i and PMi-A, the required CNC option is as follows.

p.ul: above two optional functions are not required.

option.type: Series 16/18, 16i/18i This function is related to the high-speed cycle cutting option.

add.p: But, this function is related to the compile parameter of the macro-executor. See the "PROGRAMING MANUAL" of the macro-executor for details of the compile parameter.
